hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
source /home/test/.bashrc #Check available version in repo : rhel6.9 package_name="scala" published_version="2.12.4"
available_version=$(sudo yum info $package_name | grep Version | head -1 | cut -d ':' -f 2| cut -d ' ' -f 2) PRETTY_NAME="Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server release 6.9 (Santiago)"
if [[ $available_version == *"$published_version"* ]]; then echo "Version $published_version is already available in repo for $PRETTY_NAME." echo "Exact name: $available_version ... Failing" exit 1 else echo "Published version is not available in repo. Going ahead." fi
#==============================================================================================#
# Install dependencies sudo yum install -y wget tar
export work_dir=`pwd` wget https://github.com/AdoptOpenJDK/openjdk9-releases/releases/download/jdk-9%2B181/OpenJDK9_s390x_Linux_jdk-9.181.tar.gz tar -xvzf OpenJDK9_s390x_Linux_jdk-9.181.tar.gz export JAVA_HOME=$work_dir/jdk-9+181 export PATH=$JAVA_HOME/bin:$PATH java -version
# Download and install Scala wget http://www.scala-lang.org/files/archive/scala-2.12.4.rpm sudo rpm -ivh scala-2.12.4.rpm
# Check Scala binary and compiler version scala -version scalac -version
# Testing Scala Sample Program echo ' object HelloWorld { def main(args: Array[String]) { println("Hello, world!") } } ' > HelloWorld.scala
# Compile the Test Program scalac HelloWorld.scala
# Execute the test program scala HelloWorld > test_result.txt
# Following ouput should be observed: # Hello, world! echo 'Hello, world!' > expected_result.txt
result=`diff test_result.txt expected_result.txt`
if [ -z "$result" ] ; then exit 0 else exit 1 fi
